message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is likely suffering from polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), which is often accompanied by abnormal hair growth and weight issues, as well as other symptoms such as hirsutism and acanthosis nigricans. The hormonal oral contraceptive is used to regulate menstrual cycles and treat symptoms of PCOS. Among the options, only thickening of cervical mucus is a property of endometrial protective hormones, which helps prevent sperm from reaching the ovum. The other options are properties of other types of hormonal contraceptives.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question asks about the endometrial protective hormone found in the oral contraceptive. Among the options, only thickening of cervical mucus is a property of this hormone. Decrease in thyroid binding globulin is associated with estrogen, decrease in LDL is associated with progesterone, and increase in bone fractures is not associated with any of the options.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The correct answer is B. Hormonal contraceptives that contain estrogen and progesterone work by preventing ovulation and altering cervical mucus viscosity to prevent sperm from entering the uterus. They do not have an effect on thyroid binding globulin or bone fractures, but they can decrease LDL levels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question asks about the endometrial protective hormone found in the oral contraceptive. Among the options, only thickening of cervical mucus is a property of this hormone. Decreasing thyroid binding globulin is a property of estrogen. Decreasing LDL is a property of progestin. Increasing bone fractures is not a property of any hormone in the oral contraceptive.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Orally administered hormonal contraceptives contain a combination of estrogen and progestin. Progestin, found in this oral contraceptive, thickens cervical mucus, making it more difficult for sperm to reach the egg for fertilization. Option A is incorrect as this property is associated with estrogen. Option C is incorrect as hormonal contraceptives may increase LDL. Option D is incorrect as hormonal contraceptives are known to increase bone mineral density and decrease the risk of fractures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is likely suffering from polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), which causes abnormal facial hair growth and velvety skin. Oral contraceptive pills are commonly used to treat PCOS, and they work by thickening cervical mucus, which makes it harder for sperm to reach the egg. Option A is incorrect because the hormone found in oral contraceptives does not affect thyroid binding globulin levels. Option C is incorrect because the hormone found in oral contraceptives may increase LDL levels. Option D is incorrect because the hormone found in oral contraceptives actually increases bone density and decreases the risk of fractures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history suggest polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), which is associated with increased facial hair growth and insulin resistance. Hormonal oral contraceptives are commonly used to treat PCOS, and they work by thickening cervical mucus to prevent sperm from reaching the egg. None of the other options are properties of the endometrial protective hormone found in oral contraceptives.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient likely has polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) and is started on a hormonal oral contraceptive to help regulate her menstrual cycles and decrease facial hair growth. One of the properties of hormonal oral contraceptives is thickening of cervical mucus, which helps prevent sperm from reaching the egg. Answer choice A is incorrect because hormonal oral contraceptives can increase thyroid binding globulin. Answer choice C is incorrect because while hormonal oral contraceptives can decrease LDL cholesterol, it is not a property of the endometrial protective hormone specifically found in this contraceptive. Answer choice D is incorrect because hormonal oral contraceptives are actually associated with a reduced risk of bone fractures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) and is started on hormonal oral contraceptive. Among the listed properties, only thickening of cervical mucus is a property of the endometrial protective hormone found in oral contraceptives. It also helps regulate menstrual periods and decrease androgen hormone levels, which can help with symptoms of PCOS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has signs of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), which is associated with insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes mellitus. The hormonal oral contraceptive will help regulate her menstrual cycles and reduce androgen hormones that cause abnormal hair growth. Option (B) is correct because the hormone in the oral contraceptive, progestin, thickens cervical mucus to hinder sperm penetration. Option (A) is incorrect because the hormone in the oral contraceptive, estrogen, increases thyroid binding globulin. Option (C) is incorrect because the hormone in the oral contraceptive, estrogen, decreases LDL cholesterol. Option (D) is incorrect because the hormone in the oral contraceptive, estrogen, increases bone density and reduces the risk of fractures.
